pyao.cameras¶

class pyao.cameras.AOCamera[source]¶

A template for subclassing AO camera classes.

close()[source]¶

Close this camera interface.

Args:
none
Kwargs:
none
Returns:
None
getImage()[source]¶

Calls this object’s updateImage() and gets its _im array.

Args:
none
Kwargs:
none
Returns:
numpy.ndarray of type numpy.uint16, the image
getImagePtr()[source]¶

Gets a pointer to this object’s _im array.

Args:
none
Kwargs:
none
Returns:
ctypes pointer, reference to the image
getIntegrationTime()[source]¶

Gets this object’s integration time, in seconds.

Args:
none
Kwargs:
none
Returns:
float, integration time in seconds
getPixelSize()[source]¶

Gets this object’s physical pixel size, in meters.

Args:
none
Kwargs:
none
Returns:
float, size of binned pixel in meters
getShape()[source]¶

Gets this object’s shape. For example:

>>> imHeight,imWidth = cam.getShape()
>>> print imHeight
512
Args:
none
Kwargs:
none
Returns:
tuple containing height,width of image
updateImage()[source]¶

Updates this object’s _im array. Can be implemented in a variety of ways, depending on hardware (using the camera’s API, in combination with ctypes (see pyao.cameras.AOCameraMatrox) or by reading images from the disk (see pyao.cameras.AOCameraSim), for example.)

Args:
none
Kwargs:
none
Returns:
None

A class representing a Matrox camera
